intro: Verbascum abieticola, commonly known as the alpine mullein, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, velvety leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Verbascum abieticola is often found in alpine meadows and is considered a hardy, low-maintenance plant in horticultural settings.
